meanings.definition: The quality of being logically or factually sound.
meanings.sent1: The validity of his argument was clear to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted multiple experiments to ensure the validity of her findings.
meanings.sent3: The validity of the excuse was so obvious that even the teacher chuckled.
meanings.sent4: Her logic had the validity of a sturdy bridge, supporting her conclusions with strength.
meanings.sent5: The validity of his reasoning shone brightly, leaving no room for doubt.

meanings.definition: The state of being legally or officially acceptable.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer questioned the validity of the document presented in court.
meanings.sent2: The validity of the contract was confirmed by the signatures of both parties.
meanings.sent3: The validity of the parking ticket made him laugh out loud.
meanings.sent4: Her diploma was the validity of her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The validity of the license was crucial for him to start his new job.

meanings.definition: The quality of being well-grounded or justifiable.
meanings.sent1: The validity of her decision was evident in the positive outcomes that followed.
meanings.sent2: His actions were always guided by the validity of his moral principles.
meanings.sent3: The validity of his excuse made his friends burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her arguments had the validity of a solid foundation, convincing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The validity of his beliefs resonated with those around him, earning their respect.
